Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Indocyanine Green and Technetium Nanocolloid for Sentinel Lymph Node Detection in Pediatric Cancer

Participants.evidence: 15 pediatric patients were prospectively included based on specific eligibility criteria. Conducted at UMC Utrecht

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the feasibility of using indocyanine green (ICG) combined with 99m technetium nanocolloid (ICG–TC) for sentinel lymph node (SLN) detection in pediatric patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the intraoperative detection rate of SLNs

Number_Analysed.evidence: SLNs were transcutaneously visible in 10/15 (67%) patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: SLNs were transcutaneously visible in 10/15 (67%) patients. Intraoperatively, 35/37 (95%) SLNs were fluorescent, and 37/37 (100%) were radioactive
